headline: Quick and Easy Shrimp Fajitas
description: This is a twist on a classic recipe using shrimp instead of beef or chicken. I use regular old taco seasoning to make it easier, but any seasoning combination for fajitas will work. Serve with refried beans and Spanish rice to make an easy meal!
name: Quick and Easy Shrimp Fajitas
recipeIngredient: 1 pound medium shrimp - peeled and deveined

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the red and green bell peppers, and onion. Cook, stirring frequently until peppers are hot, but still slightly crisp, about 5 minutes. Remove from the skillet and set aside.

Pour the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of oil into the skillet, and add the shrimp. Cook, stirring occasionally, until pink and opaque. Reduce heat to low, and return the peppers and onion to the skillet. Stir in taco seasoning and water so that everything is evenly coated. Simmer until peppers are heated. Serve in warm tortillas.

review.reviewBody: Delicious and very easy to make!

I used a fajita seasoning packet instead of taco. Also mixed the fajita seasoning in the water and let the shrimp 'marinate' while I cooked the peppers and onions. When I added the shrimp I set aside the rest of the seasoned water then added it to the pan when I added the peppers and onions back to continue cooking them. It turned out delicious!

Tasted ok but nothing special. Not sure if I used too much taco seasoning, or it just overpowered the shrimp, because I could not taste the shrimp. Cooked peppers for almost 10 minutes and the red pepper was still very hard. Will not make again. Have made better (but more difficult) shrimp tacos/fajitas.

I made the recipe as written, but I think the taco seasoning overpowered the shrimp; it didn't complement it. So next time I will either use about half of the taco seasoning mix or make my own. I guess it's all what suits you. Good "base" recipe.
Super easy to make. Iâ€™m going to marinate the shrimp next time to boost flavor.
Quick easy and delicious
This was very good! Quick and easy. Did add some cilantro once everything was in the pan together. Will definitely make it again!
Use spicy taco seasoning
Very good very easy

This was quick and easy to make. I like taco seasoning enough (and it made it so much easier to do), but in the future I would probably make a lighter seasoning to enhance the flavor of the shrimp. But if you want quick and easy and tasty, this is the way to go.
It was so easy to make, even after a long day at work. And it was delicious!!!! Tasted like something from a great restaurant

I give it a five star cuz I mixed it up a bit!! I made it the same as the recipe said for the filling but I used the fried taco recipe for the shell (tortilla) and added chopped spring mix lettuce and cheese and came out incredible!! Love the idea of the fried tortillas! Not to crispy and not to soft! U gotta try it!!!
Delicious and easy! I used 3 tablespoons of homemade taco seasoning and it had just the right kick. Thanks Annemo
made as directed..did not like it.

Awesome is the only way to describe this recipe. Easy, quick with a sophisticated taste. Followed the recipe for the most part, except these minor changes. Used Fajita packet seasoning instead of taco (as that is all I had on hand), added hot pepper flakes while frying the peppers and onions & 1/2 cup of fresh rough chopped cilantro. Served it with Mexican rice & beans. OMG it was so yummy. It is great recipe as I always have frozen peeled shrimp, Fajita seasoning, peppers and onions on hand. Thank you so much for sharing this wonderful recipe with us all.
These were good, but felt they needed something. I can't decide what. I think I will try the cucumber salsa that another person mentioned and/or fresh tomato.
Turned out fantastic...I don't usually like shrimp but this was very good...
needed a little thicker sauce
For a college student this was super easy!!!
Simple recipe and very good. However, I did substitute bell peppers with sweeter and slightly spicier peppers.
Very basic, quick and easy recipe for shrimp fajitas that taste really good depending on the taco seasoning you use. You can make these in no time.
Excellent and easy to make. New family favorite.
It was delicious! My son is picky and doesn't normally eat shrimp and he asked for seconds and hoped there was enough for leftovers later! Definitely making this again!
We really liked this recipe. Quick and easy on a weekday night. A definite keeper.

delicious and so easy I did take the suggestion and marinated the shrimp in lime juice and fresh cilantro while I chopped the veggies Hubby said it was better than the fajitas at our fav Mexican place!
Excellent fajitas. Would definitely make them again. Kids loved them too!
Love this recipe, I made my own taco seasoning,(thanks to a reviewer for the recipe)

Were it not for the packaged taco seasoning and an overload of it to boot, this would easily have been a 5-star recipe. Make your own taco seasoning - there are some good recipes for that on this site. This time I used Healthier Taco Seasoning I. Add it simply to taste; in my case that meant far less than the recipe called for. Five stars.
Loved it! And it does work even better w/ fajita seasoning.
Exactly the recipe I needed! Simple, flavorful and fast! I didn't use the peppers because Hubby doesn't eat them, so I used mushrooms instead. He loved it! Thank you so much!

I wanted to make something new for dinner besides the same old spaghetti or hamburger helper. I had chicken and tortillas and this recipe came up with the ingredient search. So glad it did! It was a hit and my husband ate almost the whole batch and I almost didn't get to have any! He said it was amazing and the best thing I have made for a while haha!
Marinade your shrimp with taco seasoning, fresh lime and olive oil. Otherwise it will be bland. I also made a salad of shredded cabbage, cilantro and lime to use in shrimp tacos.
Took the shortcut with frozen shrimp and used fajita seasoning instead if taco seasoning Very tasty.

My husband loved it. Said it was better than the restaurante's fajitas. I didn't have bell peppers so I just did onion sliced up. I sautÃ©ed the onions in olive oil and then was too lazy to take them out (and my husband likes them really caramelized anyhow). So I just put shrimp in their with them. It was so easy and we served it in corn tortillas cause that's what we like! We used Lawry's taco seasoning too cause it is by far the best!

This recipe is so delicious. My husband keeps requesting this and it is so easy to make. Love the flavor and the aroma while cooking. I used my cast iron skillet to brown evenly. This is a dinner favorite. This is our new addiction. Thank you.

I actually skippd the taco seasoning...marinated the shrimp in crushed garlic and lime juice with chili powder. I cooked the peppers and onions then added the shrimp to the mix to cook until pink. I served with store bought pico de gallo - a mix of tomato, onion, jalapenos and cilantro. It was PERFECT!
This was really good! Would use a spicier taco seasoning mix next time though.

Not bad. For a quick and satisfying meal, this hit the spot. My days are long, so I appreciate filling meals that can be prepared in a short amount of time. Having said this, I do think I prefer a more basic (i.e. garlic & lime) treatment for my shrimp. While I enjoyed this, I am not sure I'd ever pair taco seasoning with shrimp again. Mexican rice, chips, guacamole and margaritas completed our easy weeknight meal. Thanks for sharing your idea, Anne! :-)

Recipe was quick but not as delicious as i thought. Recipe was a little bland and not flavorful. What i did was add a little cumin and coriander like someone suggested and it gave a little bit more flavor to the shrimp. 

Thanks for the recipe nontheless!
I love this recipe... Very delicious & easy!!!

Very tasty!!! The only two things I did differently was sauteed the veggies and added the shrimp to them; I did not take veggies out of the skillet and then cook shrimp. I also added garlic powder. Try this at least once, you will not regret it.

Have had this a couple of times now & need to try something different because using the package of taco seasoning mix leaves it grainy tasting. Either we need to add the taco mix earlier or add more liquid to simmer longer, haven't decided which I'll do. Only other solution would be to use our other fajita recipe & use the shrimp in it because I know that isn't grainy tasting.
These were so good and so easy to make. My husband and I loved them and ate it all! We even served some of the shrimp over rice. This will definitely be one of my go-to shrimp recipes.
Really good. I added some hot sauce and the juice and rind of a lime to sauce.
Way too much taco seasoning. Should have done 1/2 package. I wiped off the sauce with paper towels and made another fajita. Husband thought it was ok but not great.
Great tasting and easy recipe! Everyone raved about this at our family gathering. I followed the recipe as written.
Definitely quick and easy for a hot summer night. Used less taco seasoning. Next time will add some chopped avocado, or guacamole. Hubby added more spice (as always).
Absolutely delicious and what an easy dinner! Marked a "fav" for me and my 2 adult sons.
I have made Shrimp Fajitas like this for years...also add chicken to them sometimes..easy and quick for a weeknight supper..Yummy!!!

very good, especially since shrimp aren't too expensive here in Mexico, so we have them a lot. Instead of packaged taco seasoning however, I make my own fajita seasoning according to a recipe from my housekeeper: 1 t corn starch, 2 t chili powder (again I make my own), 1 t salt, 1 t Spanish Paprika, 1 t sugar, 1 t powdered chicken stock, 1 t onion powder, 1 t granulated garlic, 1/4 t cayenne ( or to taste), 1/2 - 1 t powdered cumin. I keep this on hand and use when needed. 
Also used the tip from another review and let raw shrimp marinate a bit with chopped cilantro and a little lime juice (not too long or you have ceviche, which can be good, but just not here)

We're not a big pepper fan family so we eliminated those. A sprinkle of crumbled feta is absolutely phenomenal in these! Heck - they're even good enough to stand on their own.
Another "tip" is to use cleaned/frozen shrimp - cooked or uncooked and cut the tails off while frozen. Makes it so much easier.
My wife says this is my best diner yet.

These turned out better than expected. The only modification I did was i changed the water to 2 tbs water and 1 tbs lime juice. I also used the leftovers to make a salad the following evening, and it turned out great as a leftover.

Also, to make it gluten-free, I used corn tortillas.
Delicious! We are really into shrimp fajitas/tacos right now so this was perfect for us! I made "Chipotle Mayo Relish" from this site to go with. We loved them! Thanks!
Very good and I am not a seafood person!! Will make these again..

easy, tasty and oh so yummy! toppped with sour cream and hot sauce with spainish rice as a side. i loved this! my husband did too. he put the rice inside the fajita for extra substance and used salsa for a topping. either way, a huge winner in my house. thanks so much for the recipe!
My kids loved this recipe and it was so fast and simple.

I was looking for a tasty Quick meal with the shrimp I had thawed. This hit the spot. I didnt have the peppers so I used a tomato and the onion. I pt the tomato in when I put in the shrimp. They cooked too quick next time I'll put them in when the shrimp are almost done. I recomend this to anyone looking for a quick tasty meal.
Yummy!
Super easy and quite tasty...Will make it again!
this shrimp goes awesome with homemade tortillas and homemade chunky guacamole!!!!

I made this for dinner tonight since I had nothing thawed and some cooked shrimp in my freezer. It was simple and pretty good. I did sprinkle cheese on top and would have added sour cream and guacamole if I had them. I had to make my own taco seasoning and so I spiced it up a bit with cayenne...

Super simple and very tasty! We served ours with normal "taco" toppings - shredded cheddar, diced tomatoes, shredded lettuce, sour cream and salsa with beans, rice and chips on the side. Everyone enjoyed them!

This is excellent & oh so easy! I followed the recipe exactly & served it with a side of Mexican Rice & corn tortillas. What a great way to get a fast, easy & delicious dinner on the table in no time & with minimal effort. Will be making this again, thanks for sharing!
Very good and very simple :). I used it with Taco Seasoning I and had a fabulous dinner on the table in 20 min. Thanks!
this wasn't very good to us. Not as good as other fajita recipes i've tried.
Super quick and easy, I am always apprehensive with shrimp because it's not my favorite thing. But I was very impressed with the great flavor.

This was, as stated, quick and easy. It was also beautiful. You can add still more color and yet another later of flavor, by using spinach tortillas...oh and for adding tang...lemon or lime juice instead of water. ;o)
Easy and delicious!!
not very tasty
I used fajita seasonings and sliced the onions to match the peppers. We topped the fajitas with cheese, lettuce, and sour cream. Served with spanish rice. Very good!
Excellent recipe! My husband also loved this one! We topped ours with sour cream, lettuce, cheese, and a little hot sauce and it was delicious! We also had rice and refried beans. Quick and Easy!
So good, I've just decided that this is now one of our "weekly" menu items because it is so easy, inexpensive to make using frozen shrimp, and healthy. Yummm!
it was really easy and very good. I will definitely make it again!

I added cayenne pepper to give it a kick and next time we'll be adding mushrooms & japalenos (seeded, of course). The shrimp ended up being overly done; I'm wondering if it needs to simmer with the vegetables instead of cooking it then simmering it. I would mix the seasoning with water (if that is possible)...I feel like parts of it ended up having concentrated taco seasonings despite the fact that I stirred, flipped & mixed it in. Overall, we enjoyed it. We enjoyed spicy food so the cayenne was a good compliment!!!

The title of this recipe says it all: SUPER quick and easy!! We loved this recipe. I used most of the taco seasoning and I didn't think the taste was too overpowering at all. I diced up a few tomatoes and added a dollop of light sour cream to the shrimp mixture in my tortilla. But other than that, I followed the rest of the recipe as written. It was so delicious and healthy for you. (Well, less the sour cream, I suppose!) Try this recipe - - you will not be disappointed.

A nice change of pace from the traditional chicken fajitas. I did marinate the shrimp for about an hour in lime juice and garlic. I also added a little of the taco seasoning and chopped garic to the green peppers and onions while they were cooking. Like previous reviews I didn't use all of the taco seasoning( probably a little more than half) I used Old El Paso. Everyone liked them and will probably make again. I topped them with sour cream and shredded cheddar cheese.
Excellent. Served with Zatarain's "Dirty Rice mix" rice.
I used frozen peppers and onion to cut back on time and it turned out great. My family loved this!
This was awesome. Try placing some of the Fajita mixture on top of a bed of spinach leaves. Awesome salad.

This was very yummy! I made it for a get-together with some friends and they ate every last bit! I live overseas where I can't run to Wal-Mart and buy taco seasoning, but I do have quite a bit of Tony Chachere's cajun seasoning that I brought with me. I think I might try it with that next time instead of th taco seasoning!

I've made this twice now, once with taco seasoning and once with fajita seasoning. Both times, it's turned out delicious! I agree you don't need the entire seasoning packet... but I've added cumin, corriander, & lime juice! Also, I serve it with mexican rice so you don't have to use the tortilla for an even leaner meal.

Like the other reviews recommended, I cut the ingredients by half and used frozen cooked shrimp for convenience. With only a half of seasoning packet I felt it made plenty of sauce and the shrimp had plenty flavor, no marinating needed. Thanks for sharing, will def make this again!

They were pretty good, and a nice way to get some fresh veggies into dinner... I think there was way too much seasoning though, as the shrimp just got covered and was completely overwhelmed. I also never have had shrimp in a fajita before, and I'm still not sure how I feel about it... I will probably end up making this again, with *much* less seasoning on the shrimp!
very good and easy to make!
awesome easy recipe. great for some one in need of a fast lunch. I followed it exactly except I added Basel and shrimp seasoning.
These are excellent! I definitely agree that cumin, corriander and lime juice should be added for that extra flavor.

These were pretty good, definitely quick and easy. I only used 1/2 packet of taco seasoning. We topped the fajitas off with sour cream and shredded cheddar. I think I like chicken and beef fajitas better, but these are a nice alternative.
It was ok I don't think I would do it again.

I used this recipe last night and it was really good. I only used half a package of McKormicks Taco seasoning and added some garlic and pepper to taste. I also added a little sour cream and taco sauce to the fajita and it turned out really good. I made the spanish rice on the side but ended up saving it for tonight to go with Broiled tilapia.
Very good Fajitas...almost like my favorite Mexican restaurant. I did however add fresh chopped garlic and made my own taco seasoning. YUM!
Super easy and quick. Husband and teenagers loved it. Will make it again.
Delicious, Easy, Fast and Yummy!!!!!!! Thanks for the great idea.
I used half of the shrimp and taco seasoning and I found this worked well. It was still a little salty. Overall a delicious recipe that I will be using again.
This dish was delicious! It was light and filling! It was the perfect meal for a night after work. It was quick, easy, and all around delicious!
This was probably a good recipe, I just cooked it wrong.
so good and easy. i made exactly as the recipe says. except i sliced my onion.

Good! I used a yellow bell pepper instead of red just because that's what I had on hand. I used fajita seasoning because I had a packet that had been hanging out in my cupboard for months, but next time will try using taco seasoning. I served it in tortillas with Cucumber Salsa (AR recipe). Thanks! :)
Weight watcher friendly, family loved it, budget friendly and easy to cook - what's not to like???
